intro: Peucedanum baicalense, commonly known as the Baikal angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves with a distinctive parsley-like aroma. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The roots of Peucedanum baicalense are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
